title: How to Remove Tea or Coffee Stains from Earthenware

methods.name: Vinegar and salt or baking soda

steps.headline: Rub the tea or coffee stain with the vinegar and either with salt or moistened baking soda (bicarbonate of soda).
Pour 1 teaspoon of bleach into and earthenware cup.
Rinse thoroughly the following day.
steps.description: If there are any parts of the stain that have not budged, scrub well.

steps.headline: Scrub the stain with the moistened salt.

text: Vinegar and salt or baking soda Rub the tea or coffee stain with the vinegar and either with salt or moistened baking soda (bicarbonate of soda).  Rinse off.  Bleach (for earthenware cup) Pour 1 teaspoon of bleach into and earthenware cup.  Fill with water.  Leave to stand overnight.  Rinse thoroughly the following day. If there are any parts of the stain that have not budged, scrub well. Repeat if needed.  Salt Moisten salt with some water  Scrub the stain with the moistened salt.  Rinse well.  Repeat if needed.
